content: The curr_chunk is a section titled "GRANTING OF COPYRIGHT." Copyright is granted to Inna Hecker Grade and her successors in the works of Chaim Grade for 50 years from June 26, 1982. The copyright owner has all rights and remedies provided by law, with no liability for lawful uses made before the enactment of this Act. The Act grants copyright to Inna Hecker Grade and her successors in the works of Chaim Grade for 50 years from June 26, 1982. It provides rights and remedies with no liability for lawful uses made before the enactment of the Act. The Act also covers business undertakings involving expenditure related to the exploitation, production, reproduction, or circulation of such works for one year after the enactment date. The Act grants copyright to Inna Hecker Grade and her successors in the works of Chaim Grade for 50 years from June 26, 1982. It provides rights and remedies with no liability for lawful uses made before the enactment of the Act. The Act also covers business undertakings involving expenditure related to the exploitation, production, reproduction, or circulation of such works for one year after the enactment date. SEC. 2. WORK SUBJECT TO COPYRIGHT. The works of Chaim Grade covered in section 1 include various titles such as "Yo," "Musarnikes," "Dojrois," "Oyf di Hurves," "Pleitim," "Farvoksene Vegn," "Der Mames Tzavoe," "Shayn fun Farloshene Shtern," "Mayn Krig Mit Hersh Rassayner," and "Yerushalaim shel Maylah, Yerushalaim shel Matah." Chaim Grade's works include titles like "Hurbin," "Vilna," and "Talmidei-Hahomin in der Lite." Chaim Grade's works include titles like "Talmidei-Hahomin in der Lite," "Oyf Mayn Veg Tzu Dir," "Dos Alte Hoyz," "Fun Unter der Erd," "Yury Goresha," and "Alte Boherim." Chaim Grade's works include various titles such as "The Ground," "The Bachelors," "Wrestling with the Angel," "Collected Poems, 1932-82," "Chaim Nachman Bialik," "H. Leivik, The Poet of Suffering and Fate," "H. Leivik in my Life and my Works," and "Itzik Manger, the Poet of Beauty and Play." In the Yiddish literature section, titles include "Three Yiddish Classics," "Anski, the Champion of Enlightenment," "Problems of a Yiddish Writer," "My Path in Yiddish Literature," and "Encounter with Soviet Yiddish Writers." In the Yiddish literature section, titles include "My Encounter with the Soviet Yiddish Writers," "Three Dramatic Poems," "Three Motives in My Works," "Young Vilna and its Milieu," "The Return to Zion," and "The Sabbath and the Weekdays in Yiddish Literature." In the Yiddish literature section, titles include various topics such as "The Mussarists and the Lithuanian Yeshivas," "The Jewish Way of Life in Eastern Europe and Rabbi Israel Baal`Shem'Tov," and "The Talmudic Scholar in Yiddish Literature." In the Yiddish literature section, titles include discussions on the Memorial Service for Count Potocki, Dr. Samuel Ravidovitch's philosophy and struggle for Jewish life worldwide, and the question of whether Yiddish writers in Soviet Russia were Marranos. In the Yiddish literature section, there are discussions on various topics such as the Memorial Service for Count Potocki, Dr. Samuel Ravidovitch's philosophy, and the question of whether Yiddish writers in Soviet Russia were Marranos. Other topics include lectures and essays on different subjects like Rabbi Jehudah Ibn Samuel Dr. Kaufman, The Song of Songs, Saffed and Mount Miron, the greening of Israel, and the significance of Vilna. In the Yiddish literature section, topics include discussions on various subjects like the Memorial Service for Count Potocki, Dr. Samuel Ravidovitch's philosophy, and the question of Yiddish writers in Soviet Russia. Other topics cover lectures and essays on Rabbi Jehudah Ibn Samuel Dr. Kaufman, The Song of Songs, Saffed and Mount Miron, the greening of Israel, and the significance of Vilna. Additionally, there are essays on different themes such as "What Made Vilna Unique?", "Jewish Life in Vilna Before World War II", "The New Hebrew Literature and the Young Generation in Israel", and "The Survivors". In the Yiddish literature section, topics include discussions on various subjects like American Yiddish poets Morris Rosenfeld, Avrohom Reisen, Walt-Lessin, and Mani Leib, as well as other works of Chaim Grade. Any other works of Chaim Grade, whether published or unpublished.
